betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Anvils have definitely fallen out of favor when it comes to keeping things repaired, but they still have their uses in applying enchantments.

Thaumium Anvils are more resilliant than their iron counterparts, and are able to manage up to 60 levels worth of applying (or combining) enchants. They also don't have any penalties repairing the same item repeatedly, but you don't expect to make much use of that trait.

What Thaumium Anvils cannot do is repair themselves like other Thaumium items, there's simply way too much of it here for that to be practical, or apply enchants beyond their normal level cap. I.E. you could get a Sharpness VI book from Disenchanting an Overchanted item, but using that book in an anvil would only yield Sharpness V still.

Â§3Diamond Spikes are an example of items you want to enchant, but that cannot be enchanted easily through means other than books in an anvil.
